newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Choppy BTPs have one eye on 134.84 top.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Choppy BTPs have one eye on 134.84 top.

text.p: September BTP futures on LIFFE will chop around in a range on Wednesday but could find the tug from the 134.84 record high too hard to resist, technical analysts said.

"We're looking for further choppy, range-trading action between 133.75 and 134.84 ahead of a return to a bull trend," Robin Wilkin, senior technical analyst at MCM YieldWatch in London, said. "Hourly studies are still bullish and we could see a push up into that area."
BTPs were quoted at 134.57 at 0729 GMT, up 16 basis points from Tuesday's settlement.
BTPs reached an all-time high of 134.84 on June 26.

Wilkin said the contract would aim for 135.16 if it managed to pierce 134.84. That level represents a 61.8 percent retracement of the last move higher from 132.55 on June 19 to the high at 134.84, projected off the 133.75 low on June 27.
David Wood, independent technical analyst near London, said the contract could push higher.

"It's quite constructive in that we've held 133.75 over the last couple of days," he said. "As long as we hold above 134.30/15 that will keep up the short-term momentum as we try for the highs and 135.00."
Both Wood and Wilkin said the main support level was at 133.75.
"If we lost 133.75 we could see a pull back to 132.64," Wilkin said. That level was a 38.2 percent retracement of the rally from the June 10 low of 129.07 to the high at 134.84.
At the short end, September Eurolire were quoted at 93.52, unchanged on the day.
